name: input
help: path to input csv file

name: source
help: ballot image archives -- ZIP archives. basename.ext of archives.    These should be explicitly provided and are appended to either archives folder path or archives_folder_s3path to create the full path.

name: cvr
help: cast-vote-records, ZIP files, csv, or .xlsx files. (optional, multiple okay)

name: eif
help: Election Information file -- .xlsx or .csv file to provide contest name equivalencies (required, 1 only)

name: bof
help: Ballot Options File -- .xlsx or .csv file provides option name equivalencies (optional)

name: archives_folder_path
help: path to archives folder using standard election naming convention, ST_County_YYYY_Type, like "CA_San_Francisco_2020_Pri". Use '/' and not '\\' in paths.

name: archives_folder_s3path
help: path to archives folder on s3 file system using s3://bucket/prefix/ format

name: job_folder_path
help: path to results and input files folder on local system

name: job_folder_s3path
help: path to results and input files folder on s3 for lambdas coordination

name: election_name
help: Short election name used to identify election files uploaded.

name: election_desc
help: Human readable string that describes the election, like "San Francisco Consolidated Presidential Primary, 2020"

name: job_name
help: the leaf of the job path above and is calculated from job_folder_path if not provided. Used in Lambdas processing.

name: vendor
help: valid values: 'ES&S', 'Dominion', default is ES&S

name: include_archives
help: list of archive names (w/ .zip) to include in run

name: exclude_archives
help: list of archive names (w/ .zip) to exclude in run

name: precinct-folder
help: offset within the source bia zip files to precinct subfolder (default 0, -1 indicates no folder)

name: party-folder
help: offset within the source bia zip files to party subfolder (default 1, -1 indicates no folder)

name: group-folder
help: offset within the source bia zip files to group subfolder (default -1, -1 indicates no folder)

name: precinct_pattern
help: regex to extract precinct from filename

name: precinct_folder_pattern
help: regex to extract precinct from precinct folder name

name: use_cvr_columns_without_replacement
help: In theory, the EIF needs only to have the official_contest_name column and not original_contest_name column, and then we do not need to substitute the columns names before processing. However, to date, the column names have not been reliably unique and sufficiently descriptive. Thus, the column in the EIF is used as replacement CVR header so we can process it.

name: initial_cvr_cols
help: specify the initial CVR columns

name: cvr_option_regex
help: regular expression to use to extract options from decorated CVR values. this currently doesn't work very well, and instead decoration such as three-character party desigations and option numbers '(NNNNN)' are removed.

name: convert_cvr_image_cells_to_writein
help: sometimes CVR is created with writein images in cells. Convert these to 'writein:'. True for Wakulla 2018 set.

name: check_ballots
help: during cvr processing, check bia files to verify that all ballot files exist and all are represented in cvr file.

name: incremental_genbif
help: during gentemplate, code will look for already built nonBMD template and not build it again. Does not affect BMD analysis.

name: genbif_ballots_per_chunk
help: number of ballots per chunk when generating bif table.

name: genbif_chunk_limit
help: instead of processing all chunks, if this is specified, it will limit the number of chunks artificially. Used for testing

name: BMDs_exist
help: if BMDs_exist is False, then no attempt will be made to identify bmd vs nonbmd

name: BMD_det_method
help: method by which BMDs will be discriminated from nonBMDs.

name: BMD_filesize_threshold
help: if set, then this will be used instead of the default. This works for ES&S ballots that have a big difference between nonBMD and BMD ballots, but it varies based on the complexity of the ballots. This could be determined using adaptive thresholding. Size of PDF file for example, in bytes

name: include_precinct
help: precinct names to include (optional, multiple okay, default is all precincts)

name: exclude_precinct
help: precinct names to include (optional, multiple okay, default is all precincts)

name: ballotid
help: ballot numbers to include (optional, multiple okay, default is all ballots)

name: exclude_ballotid
help: list ballots that should be excluded from gentemplates phase (optional, multiple OK, default = include all ballots)

name: pstyle_region
help: json dict of region where printed style_num can be found, like {"s": 0, "p": 0, "x": 1284, "y": 2641, "h": 126, "w": 219 }

name: pstyle_pattern
help: regex to extract pstyle from OCR region

name: manual_styles_to_contests_filename
help: filename of CSV file with manually generated contest map. First column should be contest names. Columns should be headed with style_num.  each cell has '1' in it if the style has that contest. In config folder.

name: style_lookup_table_filename
help: filename lookup table to derive style from the party, precinct, and sheet. .xlsx or csv.  Columns are 'precinct','party','card_code','style_num'. Precinct and party should match path strings. In config folder.

name: threshold
help: the number of ballots of each style to combine to create ballot templates (int, default 50)

name: allow_style_from_cvr
help: when producing templates, if ballotid to style information is known, rely on it instead of reading style info from ballot.

name: all_styles_have_all_contests
help: when no "Style" column exists in cvr, sometimes all ballots have all contests and then this is a shortcut to specify the style for each ballot.

name: style_map_override
help:
if a contest cannot be mapped in a style, this provides override information. csv_str format, multiple okay entries should be 
       style_num, contest_name_str, roi_number.
The roi number can be derived by inspecting the log and is the first roi where the contest should be mapped.

name: incremental_gentemplate
help: during gentemplate, code will look for already built nonBMD template and not build it again. Does not affect BMD analysis.

name: min_ballots_required
help: during gentemplate, require that any style have at least this number of ballots. Any style that does not meet this threshold will not be generated.

name: style_from_precinct_regex
help: use this regex to extract the style from the precinct string, when they are munged together.

name: style_num_low_limit
help: lowest valid style number. Used to find likely invalid style values. Only works if the style designators are integers.

name: style_num_high_limit
help: highest valid style number. Used to find likely invalid style values. Only works if the style designators are integers.

name: include_style_num
help: style_num to include in genrois. Okay to have multiple declarations. Empty list means include all styles.

name: exclude_style_num
help: style_num to exclude in genrois. Okay to have multiple declarations. Empty list means include all styles.

name: diagnose_ocr_styles
help: style_nums to subject to extensive variations of ocr generation and reporting. Multiple ok.

name: diagnose_ballotid
help: ballot_id of ballot to produce additional diagnostic information. Multiple declarations OK.

name: writein_str
help: string used on ballots to in indicate a write-in.

name: merge_similar_styles
help: if a style is known to be identical to another style, merge them.

name: merged_styles
non_partisan_sheet0s
help: list of sheet0 numbers (0,1,...) that are the same across all parties.

name: question_contests_have_no_contest_name
help: In some layouts, the description of the contest is essentially the contest name for question type contests.

name: layout
help: type of layout for roi mapping. 'separated','fully_joined','partially_joined'

name: page_layout
help: JSON list of list of layout types in sheet, page order. Default is [['3col','3col'],...] Valid keys are '3col', '2col', '1col'

name: target_side
help: either 'left' (default) or 'right'

name: yes_no_in_descr
help: yes and no are in the description box usually when target_side = 'right' at a specific location.

name: add_line
active_region
help:
each entry is for a given set of styles, sheet, and page. Format similar to add_line. Multiple entries are OK.
{'styles':[set of styles], 's':s, 'p':p, 'x':x, 'y':y, 'h':h, 'w':w}                                     This replaces the y_offset_page_x directives. Generally, all parameters are optional except for y. The active region defines where ROIS will be searched for, and will be potentially inserted up to that boundary. Only one region is currently supported per page and only y parameter is honored.      Entries in list of styles are treated as regular expressions.

name: find_lines_region
maprois_max_slip_os
help: if a match between expected contests and rois does not occur, how far ahead should it search for the next match in rois. This should be at least 1 greater than the number of blank or filler rois.

name: contest_max_slip_os
help: if a match between expected contests and rois does not occur, how far ahead should it search for the next match in contests. This should be at least 1 greater than the number of contest in list of contests which must be skipped to get to the next contest in this style. Default of 1000 means no limit

name: mapping_mode
help:
sets mapping mode of maprois
'exact' - style_num is key to style_to_contests_dol
              the exact list of contests is available.
'tree'  - style_num is not key to style_to_contests_dol.
              but style_to_contests_dol exists. 
              Search over tree of contests.
'full'  - style_to_contests_dol is missing.
              search across all contests.

name: max_additional_descr_rois
help: If there are gaps included in description of question type contests, how many additional paragraphs should be included after splitting due to splitting on gaps. If splitting on gaps is not performed, this has no operational effect.

name: fuzzy_compare_mode
help: one of the following: 'left_only', 'right_only', 'full_only', 'best_of_all' which controls how strings are compared during fuzzy matching. 'left_only' should be used if the match is likely found in the first left characters. use 'best_of_all' (default) if it is unknown, but mapping is 1/3 the time if only one of the three modes is used.

name: split_rois_at_white_gaps
help: if true, rois will be split in at white gaps.

name: initial_white_gap
help: number of rows of white required for the initial white gap, typically after a contest header.

name: subsequent_white_gaps
help: number of rows of white required for the subsequent white gaps, typically between options.

name: split_roi_min_gap
help: minimum number of pixel rows before split will occur if 'split_rois_at_white_gaps' is enabled.

name: save_checkpoint_images
help: save checkpoint images during template and rois generation

name: unused_trailing_rois
help: number of "blank" rois that may exist and are not considered an error. This occurs at end of rois for a sheet.

name: conv_card_code_to_style_num
help:
use an additional conversion of card_code to style_num. Default True.         if False, style_num <- card_code
for ES&S, if False, this will use the card_code directly instead of extracting the style_number from the barcode. This is useful if we don't yet understand the code and do not need to index into any cvr style_num

name: use_stretch_fix
help: if true (default), enable the stretch-fix algorithm

name: h_max_option
help: maximum vertical dimension of block to be considered option (vendor specific default if not set)

name: use_ocr_based_genrois
help: if true, do not rely on breaking down rois into individual blocks, and instead use OCR-based extraction techniques

name: insert_rois_in_gaps
help: if true, then additional rois will be inserted between rois on the page. Missing rois are due to black areas. Not needed for OCR-based rois generation

name: use_style_discovery
help: This mode of operation works with use_ocr_based_genrois, and requires clear ballots without gray backgrounds. It is not necessary to understand the style system being used as the contests are assigned to the style based on what is found on the ballot. May not work if contest names are not clear or not unambiguous or if options do not exist (writeins only)

name: compare_contest_name
help: If contest name exists, it must match to declare a contest match

name: permute_option_list
help: if True (default) compare ocr option list with all permutations of ballot_option_list in EIF.  Otherwise, only compare with the options and order provided in the EIF.  Depends on state law if ballot options are shuffled on different styles.

name: rem_target_from_ocr_str
help: When working with 'use_ocr_based_genrois', and if targets are on the left, then frequently the ocr string will be preceeded by '@ ' or '(c) ', a single character and space. this control strips this when options are compared.

name: include_gentemplate_tasks
help: gentemplate includes a number of sub-tasks. This setting enables template task generation.

name: include_gentemplate
help: gentemplate includes a number of sub-tasks. This setting enables base template generation. Template_tasks must have already completed successfully.

name: include_genrois
help: gentemplate includes a number of sub-tasks. This setting enables rois generation and OCR. gentemplate must have already completed successfully.

name: include_maprois
help: gentemplate includes a number of sub-tasks. This setting enables rois mapping. genrois must have already completed successfully.

name: use_single_template_task_file
help: combine all template tasklists into a single json file, consisting of template_tasklists_dodf. Saves time instead of writing a separate file for each tasklist.

name: use_template_matching
help: use template matching instead of contours recognition by OpenCV for detecting alignment marks and timing marks.

name: save_failed_styles_to_assist_folder
help: If a style fails to map, copying them to the assist folder allows the failed styles to be reviewed and possibly add lines to assist with graphical decomposition. Not needed for use_ocr_based_genrois mode.

name: limit
help: only process this many ballots in extraction mode. (int, optional, default is 0 = no limit)

name: skip
help: continue current extraction but start at nth ballot (int, optional, default is 0)

name: include_bmd_ballot_type
help: include BMD ballots in the extraction, (Yes/No, default Yes)

name: include_nonbmd_ballot_type
help: include nonBMD ballots in the extraction, (Yes/No, default Yes)

name: expressvote_header
help: the header expected in expressvote ballots to check whether they appear valid. csv_str, single-value only. (no default, required for expressvote ballots)

name: ballot_style_override
help: when the style cannot be read from the ballot, this entry provides the style (optional, multiple OK, csv_str: "ballotid","style_num")

name: save_mark_images
help: if enabled, save every mark image in the folder results/NNNNNN where NNNNN is the ballotid.

name: incremental_extraction
help: if enabled, skip ballots that already have been extracted (i.e. marks_df record exists)

name: remove_unmarked_records
help: to allow adaptive thresholding to work properly, we maintain all records in the marks_df. When creating the combined_marks_df these are normally removed.

name: ballots_per_chunk
help: the number of ballots to include in an extraction chunk for a single lambda to process. Limited by the max lambda processing time.

name: url
help: url to official summary report for scraping operation to get all contest names and official summary vote counts.

name: lambda_function
help: name of a Lambda function to update. It should be a string with function name like 'generate_template' or 'all' if you want to update all the functions.

name: update_branch
help: branch name from which we want to update Lambda function. It should be a string with branch name like 'width-first-reorg'.

name: use_lambdas
help: True if processing should be delegated to AWS Lambdas for parallel processing.

name: use_s3_archives
help: use s3 to access archives even if lambdas is not enabled. Useful for debugging interface with s3 without using lambdas

name: use_s3_results
help: use s3 to for results even if lambdas is not enabled. Useful for debugging interface with s3 without using lambdas

name: max_lambda_concurrency
help: Limit of concurrency when chunk size is calculated to maximize concurrency.

name: op
help: operation code

name: one_lambda_first
help: When using lambdas, process one chuck fully to make sure there are no errors before launching the rest.

name: use_s3_config
help: use config data on s3, at s3://{job_bucket}/{job_name}/config/, such as EIF, BOF, etc.

name: save_lambda_task_args
help: True if you want to save task_args for first chunk in file so that lambda can be debug locally by reading this file.

name: verbose
help: set verbosity level. 0 = no messages, 1 = urgent messages only, 2 = high-level tacking, 3 = all messages. (default: 0)

name: remove
help: start over and delete all generated data.
